subject: Data
title: The Human Genome Project: Biology's Open Data Moment
description: A quick win: understand The Human Genome Project: Biology's Open Data Moment.

hook.text: In 1996, scientists made a radical decision: every piece of human DNA they decoded would be published within 24 hours.

buildup.text: The Bermuda Principles required the Human Genome Project to release all sequence data daily into public databases.

discovery.text: This open approach accelerated research globally â€” any scientist could build on the latest data immediately.

twist.text: A private company, Celera Genomics, raced to patent the genome. Open data supporters fought to keep it public.

climax.text: The public genome won. Today every genetic researcher in the world benefits from free access to human DNA data.

punchline.text: Open data saved the human genome from being patented.
